     yes, and more

     i guess an easier way to say that is are you still activly trying to discover new ways to use an instrument or is making new music a higher priority

     i'm just trying to do the best work i can

     you already told me you do, that's true enough for me

5.12.18  9:00 pm   What do you spend most of your time thinking about?

5.12.18  8:52 pm   what is the fastest tempo you have written a song in?

     almost any tempo could be considered double or half, if you so choose

5.12.18  8:44 pm   Hey Bill, big fan of your songwriting :) Could you elaborate your growth as a songwriter? What do you think made the biggest difference in improving your abilities? (Or I guess equally important, did you find anything to not help at all? haha)

     when i was much younger i wrote instrumental music only. then i wrote lyrical music. then i tried to figure out how the entire universe really works (which i actually figured out and forgot simultaneously, which i am still doing, simultaneously ever since) then i decided i wanted to get back into songwriting but my mind was melted (the universe melted it, etc) so i knew i would ultimately be stronger but also weaker at first (due to melted mind) so after a few years of helplessness, i finally decided that any starting point would have to be legitimate, so i started writing the absolute worst / weirdest stuff imaginable, on purpose, just to get started. and i discovered many magical things happening. then i recorded some of it, but i prefered to keep writing more and more and more. then i realized holy crap i'm writing much faster than i'm recording, so i recorded some more. but then i wrote much much much more. then i trained myself to write in a more structured way, rather than just starting from beginning to end crazy style. then i wrote much much more. then i combined the normal catalog with the weird catalog. then i realized holy crap i've written way way too much to ever record. so i wrote more, non-stop, for about a year and a half, this time with a cataloging system of all the existing ideas and fragments, and i was able to go through them and fix them / update them / improve them / fix them, etc. merging all the 'weird' techniques with the 'regular.' and generally got much stronger during that period, and rounded out my skills. then i decided to get them online, but then i realized, i almost forgot, videos are the trick to getting people to pay attention to the songs. so i learned how to make videos

5.12.18  8:40 pm   i demand a full album i can buy pls ur making me sad

     i prefer to release songs individually, but you can download a bunch of them and throw them into a folder and pow you've got an album. i can give you technical advice for this if you'd like

      you

     what do you mean, i've seen plenty of things get good before

     you were never in it. voids don't have anything in them
